title: Various Artists - The Rebirth Of Cool Vol. 1 (1991)@flac
description:
Rebirth of Cool is a very well picked & stylish collection of acid jazz/ jazzdance/ hip hop at first, expanding into trip hop, latin grooves, trip hop & jungle on later releases. Most tracks compiled by DJ Patrick Forge of Da Lata fame. The original UK series span 7 volumes from 1991 to 1998.
There are considerable differences between the UK & US versions. The UK catalogue nrs always start with: BRCD (cd) or BRLP (vinyl)...


The Rebirth Of Cool was at the time when it was released a very fresh series. Now, it is History.
It is relatively easy to make good compilation albums in retrospect and for that Mastercuts is a great example. The people behind the Rebirth Of Cool series were completely aware that they were contributing for the defenition of something and in a way shaping it by contextualizing the music. "The nineties will be the decade of a jazz thing, welcome to the story so far..." so starts the introduction of the first volume. Notice a certain assertiveness? Well, all seven volumes (and particularly the first three) have that quality, they almost feel like statements.
This is not a tedious series in any way. The tracks were carefully chosen and they really cover some of the most interesting scenes of the early nineties.

http://i.imgur.com/TUyNHSK.jpg" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
